net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.util

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.util.Camera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Class used to manipulate how a perspective is viewed.

    Apr 26, 2013 at 11:17:22 PM, v0.1

    Jul 2, 2013 at 6:41:22 PM, v0.2

      • move

        public void move(float dx,
        float dy,
        float dz)
        Move the Camera the specified amount in the direction of (dx, dy, dz) in the scene.
        Parameters:
        dx - The amount to move the Camera in the horizontal direction.
        dy - The amount to move the Camera in the vertical direction.
        dz - The amount to move the Camera in the oblique (depth) direction.

      • moveDirection

        public void moveDirection(float dx,
                 float dy,
                 float dz)
        Move the Camera along the specified direction (dx, dy, dz). The movement is based upon the yaw, pitch, and roll. The movement moves along the slope that these values have set.

        For example:
        If the pitch of the Camera is -90 (facing down) and moveDirection(1, 0, 0) is called, you will move 1 unit righward. Likewise, if you called moveDirection(0, 1, 0), you would move forward one (because you are facing downward).
        Parameters:
        dx - The amount to move forward by.
        dy - The amount to move upward by.
        dz - The amount to move rightward by.

      • move

        public void move(int direction,
        float distance)
        Move the Camera in the specified direction the specified amount of units.
        Options for the direction includes:
        • FORWARD
        • BACKWARD
        • LEFT
        • RIGHT
        • UP
        • DOWN
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction in which to move the Camera.
        distance - The amount of units to move the Camera.

      • lookThrough

        public void lookThrough()
        Translates and rotate the matrix so that it looks through the camera. This does basically what gluLookAt() does.

      • getLocation

        public Point3f getLocation()
        Get the Point3f instance that hold the location of the Camera at the current time.
        Returns:
        The current Location Point3f instance.

      • setCameraMode

        public void setCameraMode(int mode)
        Set the Camera movement method.
        Options include:
        • FREE: Allow the Camera to move in all directions.
        • XZ_ONLY: Restrict the Camera movement to the horizontal and oblique (depth) axiis.
        Parameters:
        mode - The mode to set the Camera movement as.
